summary: Prototype Pollution vulnerability (CVE-2022-25878) in protobufjs 6.11.2 transitive dependency of @temporalio/client-1.0.0-rc.0 with CVSS score 7.5. The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable library was removed from the Mend inventory.
userImpact: Users of @temporalio/client-1.0.0-rc.0 were exposed to a prototype pollution vulnerability that could allow attackers to modify object properties.
rootCause: Protobufjs version 6.11.2 contained a prototype pollution flaw that could be triggered via untrusted user input to util.setProperty or ReflectionObject.setParsedOption functions or by parsing untrusted .proto files.
proposedFix: Upgrade protobufjs to version 6.10.3 or 6.11.3 or later.
resolutionDetails: Issue automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory, indicating the dependency was updated or removed.
keyQuote: protobufjs before 6.11.3 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution which can allow an attacker to add/modify properties of the Object.prototype.
